titlestmt.titleproper: Office of the Messrs. Rockefeller records, Religious Interests, Series N
A Guide to the Office of the Messrs. Rockefeller records, Religious Interests, Series N FA323

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2025-01-01 05:01:22 UTC.

did.unittitle: Office of the Messrs. Rockefeller records, Religious Interests, Series N

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access note
accessrestrict.p: Open for research with select materials restricted as noted. Brittle or damaged items are available at the discretion of RAC. Material in the Rockefeller family collections that provides the names, correspondence, or activities of living members of the Rockefeller family, and/or documents the net wealth of any Rockefeller family members, is restricted. Researchers interested in accessing digital media (floppy disks, CDs, DVDs, etc.) or audiovisual material (audio cassettes, VHS, etc.) in this collection must use an access surrogate. The original items may not be accessed because of preservation concerns. To request an access surrogate be made, or if you are unsure if there is an access surrogate, please contact an archivist.

arrangement.head: Arrangement note
arrangement.p: The series is divided into twenty subseries, 11 of which are for specific churches, organizations, or movements. The sections are as follows:

American Board of Commissioners for Foreign Missions, Baptist Organizations, Bible Societies, Christian Publications, Church Unity Radio Address, Churches, Federal Council of Churches of Christ in America, Fifth Avenue Baptist Church, Park Avenue Baptist Church, Interdenominational Cooperative Movement, Missionary and Church Groups, Protestant Council of the City of New York, Religious Education, Religious Organizations, Riverside Church, Salvation Army, Seamen's Church Institute, Billy Sunday, Young Men's Bible Class, Bibles, and Oversized materials.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: The Religious Interests series reflects the Rockefeller family's interest in and contributions to various churches and religious organizations. The files contain correspondence between members of the family and the family office, as well as officials and members of the various religious institutions. In some cases, the files include financial information on the appealing institutions. The miscellaneous files generally contain unsolicited appeals for donations. The series illustrates family contributions to religious organizations up to 1962. The contributions were made to a wide spectrum of organizations and activities, such as missionary movements, interdenominational cooperation, and religious education.

Except for John D. Rockefeller, Jr., these files do not provide information on the personal religious convictions of members of the Rockefeller family. John D. Rockefeller Jr.'s ideas on the Fatherhood of God and the Brotherhood of Man are well documented. These ideas are essential elements in understanding his continuing impact on religious organizations and thought.
